qas.question: On Neptune, which clouds cast shadows on the cloud deck below it?
What are the widths of the cloud bands on Neptune?
Where are the high altitude bands of clouds on Neptune?
Where on Neptune does weather not occur?
What does Neptune have more of compared to Uranus?
On Uranus, which clouds cast shadows on the cloud deck below it?
What are the lengths of the cloud bands on Neptune?
Where are the low altitude bands of clouds on Neptune?
Where on Neptune does weather always occur?
What does Neptune have less of compared to Uranus?

context: <a0_0><b5_0>High-altitude clouds<b5_0/><a0_0/> on Neptune have been observed casting shadows on the opaque cloud deck below. There are also high-altitude cloud bands that wrap around the planet at constant latitude. These circumferential bands have widths of <a1_0><b6_0>50–150 km<b6_0/><a1_0/> and lie about <a2_0><b7_0>50–110 km<b7_0/> above the cloud deck.<a2_0/> These altitudes are in the layer where weather occurs, the troposphere. Weather does not occur in the <a3_0><b8_0>higher stratosphere<b8_0/> or thermosphere<a3_0/>. Unlike Uranus, Neptune's composition has a higher <a4_0><b9_0>volume of ocean<b9_0/><a4_0/>, whereas Uranus has a smaller mantle.
